page.title: 15Farming - Kennoway
page.content: Although situated in a fairly rural area, Kennoway does not derive many benefits from the surrounding farms. Very few of the village's population find employment on the farms compared to earlier in the century. Many of the farms themselves have changed in nature over the years, mainly as a result of economic pressure. Where there were once many thriving smallholdings, today there are, in most cases, ruins with the land incorporated into much larger farms. Most of the farms are{arable producing a mixture of products including{cereals, root crops, {legumes, brassicas and soft fruits. There is no dairy farming and only a little stock is kept on a very small number of farms.
